Class List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
dai::BipartiteGraphRepresents the neighborhood structure of nodes in a bipartite graph
dai::BipartiteGraph::NeighborDescribes a neighboring node of some other node in a BipartiteGraph
dai::BPApproximate inference algorithm "(Loopy) Belief Propagation"
dai::BP::PropertiesParameters of this inference algorithm
dai::ClusterGraphA ClusterGraph is a hypergraph with VarSets as nodes
dai::DAIAlg< GRM >Combines an InfAlg and a graphical model, e.g., a FactorGraph or RegionGraph
dai::DEdgeRepresents a directed edge pointing from n1 to n2
dai::DiffsUsed to keep track of the progress made by iterative algorithms
dai::ExactInfExact inference algorithm using brute force enumeration (mainly useful for testing purposes)
dai::ExactInf::PropertiesParameters of this inference algorithm
dai::ExceptionRepresents an exception (based on std::runtime_error)
dai::FactorGraphRepresents a factor graph
dai::FRegionA FRegion is a factor with a counting number
dai::HAKApproximate inference algorithm: implementation of single-loop ("Generalized Belief Propagation") and double-loop algorithms by Heskes, Albers and Kappen
dai::HAK::PropertiesParameters of this inference algorithm
dai::hash_map< T, U >Hash_map is an alias for std::tr1::unordered_map
dai::IndexForTool for looping over the states of several variables
dai::InfAlgInfAlg is an abstract base class, defining the common interface of all inference algorithms in libDAI
dai::JTreeExact inference algorithm using junction tree
dai::JTree::PropertiesParameters of this inference algorithm
dai::LCApproximate inference algorithm "Loop Corrected Belief Propagation" by Mooij and Kappen
dai::LC::PropertiesParameters of this inference algorithm
dai::MFApproximate inference algorithm "Mean Field"
dai::MF::PropertiesParameters of this inference algorithm
dai::MRApproximate inference algorithm by Montanari and Rizzo
dai::MR::PropertiesParameters of this inference algorithm
dai::MultiForMultiFor makes it easy to perform a dynamic number of nested for loops
dai::PermuteTool for calculating permutations of multiple indices
dai::PropertySetRepresents a set of properties, mapping keys (of type PropertyKey) to values (of type PropertyValue)
dai::RegionA Region is a set of variables with a counting number
dai::RegionGraphA RegionGraph is a bipartite graph consisting of outer regions (type FRegion) and inner regions (type Region)
dai::smallSet< T >Represents a set (optimized for a small number of elements)
dai::StateContains the joint state of variables within a VarSet and useful things to do with this information
dai::TFactor< T >Represents a probability factor
dai::TProb< T >Represents a probability measure on a finite outcome space (i.e., corresponding to a discrete random variable)
dai::TreeEPApproximate inference algorithm "TreeEP" by Minka and Qi
dai::TreeEP::PropertiesParameters of this inference algorithm
dai::UEdgeUndirected edge between nodes n1 and n2
dai::VarRepresents a discrete random variable
dai::VarSetRepresents a set of variables
dai::WeightedGraph< T >Represents an undirected weighted graph, with weights of type T
